page.title: 05A GOOSTREY MAN'S DAY
page.content:
{A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A TREE SURGEON Mr Wainwright came to Goostrey about 13 years ago.He is a self-employed tree surgeon.On a typical day he works from 8am to 6pm.
6.15am: Wakes up and has breakfast. 7.00am: Loads Landrover with chainsaw. 7.10am: Sets off for Saddleworth. 8.15am: Starts to fell Poplar trees. 9.45am: Uses timber crane to load wood 12.00: Consults forester. 12.30: Dinner break. 1.15pm: Removes branches by river bank 3.15pm: Burns tree tops and loads wood 4.30pm: Parks timber crane for night. 4.45pm: Loads chainsaw into Landrover. 6.00pm: Arrives home and unloads. 6.30pm: Evening meal. 7.15pm: Arranges future work. 8.00pm: Watches television. 11.00: Retires to bed.
